I was then able to copy all my files (130GB) onto the Sandisk 500GB drive without any problems. In fact, this thing FLIES! I love it and hope that it lasts for years.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but takes a bit of wrangling to get APFS working on MacOS
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so this drive is quite good and super fast, but to get APFS working on MacOS, you may require some footwork in the Terminal first. 1) Open the Terminal 2) Type "diskutil list" to figure out which of the disks is the SanDisk. In my case, it was /dev/disk10 3) Make sure the drive is unmounted (via Disk Utility) but NOT ejected 4) Run "diskutil apfs createContainer /dev/disk10" in the Terminal (or whatever disk # it was for you) This will create an APFS container, and then you will actually see the APFS format option in Disk Utility (I'd go ahead and just reformat it to be safe). Voila!

I had hoped to let it live in a cable "pocket" in the desk, but it makes so much heat I think keeping it in a small, poorly-ventilated space is generally a bad idea. Relatedly, these devices use so much energy (that gets dissipated as heat) that I would not recommend using it with a laptop unless you were using mains (wall outlet) power. It would be tough on battery life.

customer_reviews.title: Just setting it up, fyi read this to use "Mac OS X encryption" on the volume
customer_reviews.text: Yes, when you erase it, you can add macOS disk encryption in GUI version of DiskUtil, despite what some people claim on Amazon comments. The key is in the Erase window, FIRST in the Scheme picker, choose "GUID Partition Map" (not Master Boot Record or Apple Partition Map), and then suddenly there are extra choices including Journaled+Encrypted in the Format picker. It's unintuitive user interface, because the "format" picker is listed FIRST, but it's not obvious that the "scheme" picker below it affects what appears in the "format picker". This was in OS X 10.14.6.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

If you want your data to be encrypted, then plug it in, open the pre-loaded folder, and drag and drop into it specifically. The only difference between the two is that the encrypted choice will take 3 times longer to upload.

customer_reviews.title: So Small and Portable I lost it!
customer_reviews.text: I lost this drive... Thankfully I Keep a backup of all my work on a larger HDD, but for the time I spent with this drive I loved it. If you can keep up with it properly, this Drive will serve you well. Also whenever I opened the box I literally laughed at its size, I could not believe 1000tb storage could be so small!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Keys

customer_reviews.title: So FAST! Works with my Apple and Windows Devices.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this hard drive for a week now and absolutely love it. It is shocking how small and light it is compared to competing mechanical hard drives, and the read write speed is off the charts. I use it with my MacBook Pro, and iPad Pro. It is important to note that out of the box it is formatted in NTFS, which is NOT compatible with Mac, but using the disk utility application on my Mac I was very easily able to reformat the drive to ExFat, which made it cross compatible between all my Apple devices and also my Windows laptop for work. I would highly recommend this hard drive to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jeriah Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Small and really fast! Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sandisk Extreme portable ssd, I knew that it was going to be small but it still surprised me how small it actually it is. I took a picture for size comparison, comparing it to a coin wallet from coach and its even smaller than the wallet. I downloaded some pictures onto the ssd and it was pretty fast. So far its been a great purchase. Will update if anything goes wrong but highly doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Drive, OK Software
customer_reviews.text: Good drive - very fast, and smaller than it looks in the picture. The only drawback is the included EncryptStick software, which is already a limited version, but even after paying to upgrade it, it didn't work well for me and basically just got stuck forever. You can just forget the software and use it as a regular drive, and then it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: SegNerd

customer_reviews.title: Keeps disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Fast and lightweight. However, it often disconnects from my brand new 27" iMac (running OS X Catalina) when I restart my computer. (I have it connected via USB.) At this point I can unplug the USB connection and then plug it back in and the drive shows ups on my desktop. I am returning the drive and will go back to a traditional USB drive.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Brown

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and fast but
customer_reviews.text: This drive is tiny, fast, a great value (at $179, which I got it for before Christmas). The main issue I have is with the USB-C connector - the provided cable is VERY short, maybe 5" tops, and the adapter comes off easily and the short cable plus the adapter creates a stiff section that makes keeping the drive attached to, say, an Xbox (which we are using for) a bit tricky. I would package the drive with two, somewhat longer cables for better ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: John V. Kaprielian

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 4 months but fixed
customer_reviews.text: I am sure that most of these work well for a long time, but mine died after 4 months. Tried it on both of my computers and neither can connect. When I connect it heats up somewhat so I know it's getting power. Update - Customer Service helped me find the problem. It was the cable and not the device.
customer_reviews.author: KamLand

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: With uncanny reliability Apple comes out with new products that require you to toss all your I/O accessories, and now I have to add my USB drives to the pile that includes thunderbolt, ethernet and SCSI cords. So I chose the SanDisk SS drive with USB 3 connectors for my backup needs. Now I got that out of my system, let me talk about the device itself. It is delightful. It's so light I can carry it easily in a shirt pocket. SS is very fast, so backups and file transfers are a breeze. And the price is very reasonable. It does everything I want, only faster. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Lenk

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Nice drive while it worked. Big. Quite Fast. Cute form factor. Simple USB C cabling. But about 4 months into owning it, it started failing -- I/O errors, bad checksums, etc etc. Luckily I didn't lose anything important. It did get noticeably warm while using intensely. I wonder if that contributed to its demise.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Dirac

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow - no better than disk HDDs
customer_reviews.text: I was rather excited to be able to get a new portable SSD for backing up my new laptop. I have used regular HDD for image back ups for years and have been rather happy except for the amount of time it takes to back up a full 150gb of data. I was hoping this drive would cut down on the time it took to do that. Wow, was I wrong. This drive pokes along like grandma on the freeway. Reformatted and tried again. No improvement, so I initiated a return for refund. I guess I'll keep looking for an SSD that isn't so slow. Really no faster than disk HDDs. I DO NOT recommend this drive for image backups.
customer_reviews.author: G. O. Cacher

customer_reviews.title: great, until it disconnects
customer_reviews.text: i'm a wedding photographer and i bought this in hopes that it wouldn't crash like my other drives (because it's SSD!!). it's great, until it accidentally ejects. there have been a few times i've moved my laptop or something like that and it falls loose. it takes about 30 minutes, a few laptop reboots and consistently unplugging and replugging it in. i've tried disk utility, first aid and other laptops and it's always the same issue. beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Leamon

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 MacBook Pro's and I copy our data to a backup disk periodically to keep offsite at our daughter's home. With older portable HDD, it could take hours, now it takes minutes. If you bother to read the instructions, it says you should download the drivers. I called tech support and there are no drivers, it is plug and play. When the prices drop on the 2 TB, I plan to purchase them for the Mac TimeMachine backup. I much prefer them over the bulkier, slower HDD equivalents.
customer_reviews.author: HEH

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and super convenient
customer_reviews.text: Pretty pricey, but I've never in my life seen a hard drive (let alone an SSD) this small and fast. Seriously, this thing's tiny. Also, it comes with a USB-C cable, so it plugged right into my new Macbook with no troubles. Has a small USB adapter for the USB-C top. My go-to hard drive right now, and it'll be the one I take with me to photography gigs for sure. Super convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and great transfer rates.
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than I anticipated, I guess I didn't look at the dimensions. Great for travel and works with my samsung phone as an external hard drive as well. Transfer rates are fantastic, very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: died on day two
customer_reviews.text: A fun New Year Eve-New Year Day activity. Opened box. Formatted to ExFat 128 MB allocation. it took about 24 hrs to copy 500 GB iPhoto database onto the SSD. Then accessing the drive kept overheating the laptop so it kept shutting itself down repeatedly. Moved it to another Mac and it no longer would mount and show up as a hard drive. Back to the original Mac after it cooled down and the same issue. Appears to be dead.
customer_reviews.author: Baby O

customer_reviews.title: Small, durable and super fast! Perfect for any photo/video hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: 550MB/s is blazing fast and you won't need more than 1TB internally anymore - even when editing 4k video. Transferring 50GB used to mean a lunch break, but now I can barely refresh my coffee before it's done. I can't wait till they come out with an 8TB SSD so I can buy the 4TB at a lower price. With raw photos increasing in size and 4k videos becoming the standard (8k is overkill - just ask your eye doctor) a couple of these SSDs should be all any hobbyist videographer/photographer should need for a while. (One for back up - not because it will fail, but because it's so small you may lose it)
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Died after one week of use with MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to use with my MacBook Pro because it came highly recommended. After less than a week of use, my Mac wouldn’t recognize it anymore. It wouldn’t even let me reformat/erase it. Pretty much useless. Luckily since it was still fairly new, I was able to exchange it for another on Amazon. Fingers crossed this second one works better.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Received new item but broken
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited when i received it. Wanted to use it, backed up stuff from my computer. However, I could not format it FAT, kept given me an error. Checked it with the disk manager, found 2 bad sectors errors. Format it NTFS, it worked. Once I backed up my data. Delete it from the PC. I Could not access it again. And PC cant even read it anymore!!!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Hot and Slow
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design and short and cable is. But it's got the speed of a HDD with Time Machine. And it gets hot, which is bad for SSD life span. With same size of backup, my Samsung internal SSD stays cool and is much faster than this. I am disappointed. I should have gotten the hardware from Samsung instead. Macbook users be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs Hot.
customer_reviews.text: The read and write speed is not very consistent. I’m getting reading speed around 350 MB/s on USB 3.0 connection. Sometimes it goes to 400, but it’s not consistent. See my attached speed test pics. The drive does get hot after a while, I think it’s because the plastic case doesn’t dissipate the heat too well. I like the look and design of the case, especially it has a ring hole for hook it up on my backpack if needed. But because the inconsistency on the read/write speed and runs hot, I’m returning it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Huang

customer_reviews.title: Fast, light - the perfect travel drive
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are great. The thing is light as a feather and smaller than about a third the size of my phone. The included USB-C cable connects firmly on both ends and it recognized on my Dell Latitude immediately. My first test transfer was 100gb of high res photos and constant write speeds were sitting around 250mbs. Blazing fast compared to my previous Transcend USB3 portable SSD. Took just under 5 minutes to copy those 100gb. I will update with notes about durability and longevity in the months to come.
customer_reviews.author: David SargentTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage / Terrible Experience
customer_reviews.text: This drive handled well and seemed great for the first few weeks, and then all of a sudden (at week six), I was unable to delete any files from the drive. Terrible problem.
customer_reviews.author: J Stein

customer_reviews.title: Shame on Sandisk
customer_reviews.text: First, I ordered (and was charged for) a 2tb drive, but received a 1tb drive. Second, the USB-C cable worked with my laptop but not with my desktop. Third, the USB-3.1 dongle included also did not work with my desktop. The physical size is great but the drive simply is too expensive and unreliable to be useful. Shame on Sandisk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Richard Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Access time is as fast as an internal drive with a USB 3 port
customer_reviews.text: This is being used on a laptop with a USB 3.0 port and it is very fast despite being an external drive. The SSD is important as it provides a more durable storage device as compared to a hard disk, and provides much greater read and write speed. Native port on drive is for USB-C but an adapter cable is included for use with a standard USB 3 port on a computer. I would not use this with a computer that only has USB 2 type ports as the performance will be greatly throttled by the slow port.
customer_reviews.author: WinterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: CHECK YOUR PACKAGING BEFORE YOU DO ANYTHING ELSE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Someone switched out the Ordered 1TB product with a 250GB model. Didn’t even have the plastic bag protecting the SSD drive, which made me scrutinize the it further. When I saw the cardboard fuzz around the USB-C port, I flipped it over and that’s when my heart sunk. 250GB showing on the back. Checked the bottom of the box, and sure enough, already been sliced open. Sad. And about to leave town for vacation and the replacement drive won’t arrive in time. SHAME!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fastest drive I own so far
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed. Right out of the box, formatted for my Mac, I was getting advertised (or close to) speeds. 400GB backup on my WD Elements drive takes about 40 minutes to an hour. I did it on this in about 25. In comparison, I've yet to figure out why I'm not getting similar speeds on my external NVMe drive. May be the enclosure. A lot smaller than I thought it would be, which is nice. Expensive for 500GB, but given the consistent speed and comparable drives out there, it's a good deal at current prices.
customer_reviews.author: amazondre

customer_reviews.title: Wont mount properly
customer_reviews.text: If my Mac computer goes to sleep or if I don't "eject" the drive before I close my laptop it won't mount when I restart. I have to open Disk Utility, I see it grayed out in the list of drives, I click it and have to click "mount" and wait 5-10 min before it mounts and is recognized by any of my computers. I planned to work off of it but I find it unreliable and finicky to be able to trust it to function when I need it to. I am outside the return window as I purchased it for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Momtog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Portability and storage.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had known about these a few hard drives ago. I now have 3 of them, each 2 TB. 3 together and they are still about 1/2 the dimensional size of my not quite mighty 500 GB external hard drive. Very good response speed/rate for upload and downloads. I can't rate the quality of the Tech Support as I have not had a reason to contact them, ... positive (?), negative (?), indifferent (?), I don't know! I've had these hard drives for 18 months and thus far, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: pwc

customer_reviews.title: This is the best solution I have found for the price
customer_reviews.text: I work as a photographer and need to move a ton of files very quickly while on location to hand off to clients. This is the best solution I have found for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: My need was to have a durable, portable SSD external drive to do two things: (1) create a weekly bootable back up; and (2) have a VERY portable substitute for my laptop in some traveling settings, so when I visit a friend, I can use one of their Mac laptops but boot from my bootable cloned version, do my work that way, then whey I return home, easily 'restore' my home laptop to the new curent state. Has worked well for both of these. I now have two.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H. Elias

customer_reviews.title: OMG THIS THING IS TINY! I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Alright I guess I already knew it was going to be tiny but I didn't think about exactly how tiny it would be. This thing is super super portable and it's a rad piece of equipment. I am on the go a lot so the shock proofing is very important here. Need something nice but rugged for my backpack. This is a solid choice. The capacity is great and the portability....like I said, wait til you actually see it. And of course the speed has to be great. Usually you get one feature of the other but this has it all! I dig it. Replacing all my drives now!
customer_reviews.author: Control Room 2020

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: fast, easy to connect. I am backing up pictures and document files, so not so complicated. Note that the directions are the worst I have ever seen. Throw them away. Also, do not go to the web site shown in the directions, as it is malware. If you need help, read the comments from folks like me who purchased the item. I use Windows 10. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to Store Porn Ya Know?
customer_reviews.text: First of all. Who likes to keep porn on their phones? Makes you feel nervous when other people ask to use your phone. This little fella is amazing for this. Download the good stuff, store it there, plug in when you need your nutt. Oh, it's also amazing for photography, Cinematography and editing videos on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Rahim  Noel

customer_reviews.title: Small pocket size Ext SSD
customer_reviews.text: Hey there... The SanDisk 2TB Extreme Portable External SSD is smaller than your regular laptop HDD. It literally fits in the palm of your hand. Very fast transfer speed, very easy to use just Plug N' Play. Transfer tested with several Inner HDD, Ext HDD & USB Drv with no problem.-
customer_reviews.author: Joan Gomez G

customer_reviews.title: Two weeks later it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this item, and I had a great experience with it, how ever after weeks of using it suddenly stopped working on my Mac and I won’t even be able to open it up
customer_reviews.author: The Sun

customer_reviews.title: Files Disappear
customer_reviews.text: I must say that the use of this memory has been minimal, as a backup and nothing more. Well, today I connect it to the computer and I get the folder in which I was working is empty without any files. on the disk in properties tells me that it has the files. In front of my eyes the files disappeared. Can anyone say what could have happened?
customer_reviews.author: Vane

customer_reviews.title: Alot smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bit hesitant because of the price point. I have seen these devices at electronic stores and they were around the size of a smaller smartphone. This was a pleasant surprize when I received a SSD that was about 1.5x3 inches big! 2TB on such a small SSD is outstanding. Unfortunately, as seen across the industry, false capacity marketing still remains an issue. Mine came in closer to 1.8TB than 2TB. It comes with a USB C cable (and a USB C to USB adapter) which is lightning fast if you have a USB C port on your machine. Very satisfied thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SSD, should format to APFS for Mac use
customer_reviews.text: I own four of these drives (1TB size) and have used them heavily as Lightroom and FinalCut working drives. I learned very early that they needed to be formatted to APFS, rather than the exFAT format with which they are shipped. As other buyers have commented, this formatting makes a big difference, especially when used with smaller files. For my Lightroom library, it made 55GB worth of difference - a healthy chunk. Once each drive is correctly formatted, the performance of Lightroom and FinalCut using libraries on those external disks is indistinguishable from internal SSDs on my 2015 and 2018 MBPs. These drives have been excellent in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Bruin92

customer_reviews.title: Bootable HD for my iMac
customer_reviews.text: 2TB SSD storage and the ability to be used as the bootable HD. I cloned my MacIntosh HD to this external SSD. I rebooted and used the SanDisk as the boot drive. It works great. I can foresee getting a computer with a minimal SSD (256TB) internal drive, or a 1TB spinning internal drive to use as storage while running the machine on the external drive. The SanDisk is using a Thunderbolt port to connect and so far I cannot see much speed difference between the internal (500TB SSD) and the external drive. It's been in constant use and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Kirtley

customer_reviews.title: Encrytion Software is TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: Great flash drive. Don't quite see the benefit other than it's high capacity. Scandisk encryption software that came with it is TERRIBLE. It keeps on loosing my data. Most of the time, it decrypts my data properly but sometimes it will have an error. When you trybto repair it, it loose a lot of your data.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Best for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these with 1T 2 years ago and I use it to transfer everything that I might need from my desktop to my laptop when traveling which is quite a bit. It still works every single time with no issues. No moving parts keeps it from becoming worn out and useless. This company is known for standing behind their products. I'm not even close to being any kind of guru but I know people who have external hard drives with moving parts that don't work 6 months later. Don't settle for less when this is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Mick
